item.title: Papermod - Installation
item.description: Follow this guide to setup hugo and create a new site. Make sure you install latest version of hugo(>=0.57.1). After you have created a new site, at Step 3 follow the steps: Inside the folder of your Hugo site, run: git clone https://github.com/adityatelange/hugo-PaperMod themes/hugo-PaperMod --depth=1 Updating theme : cd themes/hugo-PaperMod git pull or you can use as submodule with git submodule add https://github.com/adityatelange/hugo-PaperMod.git themes/hugo-PaperMod Updating theme with submodule :

item.title: Papermod - Features
item.description: Assets (js/css) The following is enabled by default minification - makes the assets size smallest as possible. bundling - bundles all the styles in one single asset fingerprint/intergity check. Default Theme light/dark params: defaultTheme: light or params: defaultTheme: dark or params: defaultTheme: auto # to switch between dark or light according to browser theme Archives Layout Add vars below to page-variables layout: "archives" ex: here Home-Info Mode Use 1st entry as some Information

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Papermod - Icons
item.description: Social Icons Usage : socialIcons: # optional - name: "<NAME>" url: "<link>" - name: "<NAME>" url: "<link2>" No. name platform link 1 123rf 123rf.com 2 adobestock stock.adobe.com 3 behance behance.net 4 codepen codepen.io 5 cryptohack cryptohack.org 6 dev dev.to 7 discogs discogs.com 8 dreamstime dreamstime.com 9 dribbble dribbble.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Placeholder Text
item.description: Lorem est tota propiore conpellat pectoribus de pectora summo.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Emoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
